CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 13, 1966, pg. 2A reads: "At St. Benedict's 75th Anniversary - Prelates of the Catholic Church, members, and the general Hill District Community took part in a "Talent Show" at St. Benedict's Roman Catholic Church to celebrate the institution's 75th Anniversary last week. Among those taking part were, left to right: Mrs. Govan Martin, Monsignor Paul Bossompierre, Mrs. Earl Watson, Andrew Talley, James Humbert, Mrs. Molly Johnson Lewis, Bishop John Wright, Mrs. Cynthia Ivey, Bishop Vincent Leonard, Mrs. Martha Gay, Mrs. Celestine Jones, Leon Blackston, James Sims and Clarence Singleton.  In background is Horace and Mary Turner's Combo which provided music. (Harris Photo.)
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of men and women, including left to right; Mrs. Govan Martin, Monsignor Paul Bossompierre, Mrs. Earl Watson, Andrew Talley, James Humbert, singer Molly Johnson Lewis, Bishop John Wright in center, Cynthia Ivey, Bishop Vincent Leonard, Martha Gay, Celestine Jones, Leon Blackston, James Sims, and Clarence Singleton, standing in front of Horace and Mary Turner's Combo band, for talent show for 75th Anniversary Celebration at St .Benedict the Moor Roman Catholic Church
